quote.text: And it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they answered, that they could not tell whence it was.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable; A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent him away empty.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and cast him out.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence him when they see him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others. And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he beheld them, and said, What is this then that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they watched him, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person of any, but teachest the way of God truly:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or no?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? They answered and said, Caesar's.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he said unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar's, and unto God the things which be God's.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man's brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Last of all the woman died also.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Jesus answering said unto them, The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David's son?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Which devour widows' houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.
quote.author: Luke
